QsttAHMOLKGydhqqFBH5zw.text: I chose here simply because it is the best decorated setting of all the places on boat quay.  I saw it the first night but we went to 2 other places and finally came here our last night.... it's decent but yes over priced as others said.  We asked beforehand and knew no sides came with the dishes so we ordered Thai basil shrimp (30$), seafood fried rice (12$), Tom yum seafood soup (15$) lime juice (8$) and coke (5$) So with tax and service total was $88.  As far as taste it was fine but the Tom yum soups was EXCELLENT- loved it. But again, I came here for the pretty ambience and I loved it for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Haven Lobster & Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Haven Lobster & Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Haven Lobster & Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore

JD5pxFA6Qvo6wCMy1RilJA.text: I should of kept walking after the big sell and special discount offer. We ordered the pepper crab and only two legs came with the dish. It tasted ok and no problem there. Also got the satay sticks, tiny portions and big price.It always pays to have checked the reviews first and would have known better than dining here...

6Nch_McBcQ28m5uKTCBjxA.text: STAY AWAY ALERT!Tourist should never try, very expensive with poor quality.Very bad experience.3D.

photos.caption: Photo of Haven Lobster & Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore

rssVwt7tAbnw6GW1v9VeLg.text: I would give r a half star but it won't let me on my phone. Don't get here. They will rip you off. They will offer you food as if it is included, upcharge the bill, and then talk to you like you are stupid and are the ones who made the mistake. Nope, I've  eaten at many places before I understand how menus work.  If the food was good, I would be annoyed but it was not either. The water is lovely but 7/11 would have been better and much friendlier. Don't make my mistake!

BAsV0WO0DAsGOktNsTmVHg.text: This place is a giant scam! They accost you on the street and bully you into stopping here. I figured what the heck can't be any more than the other places but paid $175 for 1 person for dinner!!! And they charge for everything, even the napkins. What a ripoff. Should be shut down.

eNPOLoCFzMvFMonfEYC0TA.text: I should have read reviews before stopping. It was a complete ripoff. The crab dishes were practically all shell. They showed us the menu and pointed to prices, but when the bill came, turned out "we" were on the wrong page. BEWARE!!!

YpQPGzZIOhG0uOYtpwy0GQ.text: No prices advertised any ware. Very over priced. We had a rice dish and a noodle dish . All food is priced on the menu ..small medium and large.For the 2 dishes we had where medium size.. The cost was $44 + 17% the service tax and the GST. They will try charge you for the hot towel even if you don't use it.So check your bill before you pay.You are paying for the location.

crraqRE6ebpVZSTDE7SjQQ.text: In 30 years of traveling world wide, we have never been so disappointed at the poor attitudes and outrageous pricing for such mediocre food. It was 10pm.  We ordered a small green salad - $15 (and it was small), a small garlic prawns - 5 small prawns served on 6 very thin half slices of oranges on a 6" diameter plate - $30 (no rice or accompaniment), & a pinnapple rice dish - $25 (we thought the menu charge was $12 until the bill came and the waitress pointed out we were looking at the wrong price line - very misleading). The bill came to $80! Granted, this is a highly trafficked tourist area - but I would recommend any other restaurant on the river before this.

croA-sPfJ1L-RrmXlLf3Lw.text: Had to have the Singaporean Dish of chili crab - so chose this place to stop.  Food was excellent, wait staff friendly but was more interested in visiting with each other.   I recommend the chili crab!!

photos.caption: Photo of Haven Lobster & Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Messy but yummy!!

oaJeE02q7zBfoUzV6WLnOw.text: OMG!!! $360 Dinner for Two!!!Tourist beware! Do not eat here, super expensive. SCAM Alert!!! No wonder they had to stop people to eat at this place.They said it's happy hour and free drinks including beer. They still charged me for it! They also charged me for the tissue! What!I have receipt to prove it and I will post soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Haven Lobster & Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. OMG!!! $360 SGD Dinner for two!!! SCAM Alert! Do not eat here unless you want to spend $170 per person!

qJ2jANQl2S48u1q45SiXiA.text: Had chilicrab (Sri lankan crab). It was simply fantastic. Sure, restaurants by the river in the tourist trap areas are more expensive, but the view and the crab was definately worth it. I will go back again. And again. And again.

photos.caption: Photo of Haven Lobster & Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Haven Lobster & Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Chilicrab was fantastic, yes, it is expensive down by the river - but, this food was worth it. Fantastic!

zeqWFNTrzTJ4TrOmMvVJbA.text: Would've given 0 stars if Yelp let me so will have to compromise with 1.  Waste of time and money here.  I knew better as person outside the restaurant with the hard sell got me to stop by.  Promised me 20 percent off the menu and kids were tired of walking in the heat so we stopped there.  Food was lousy and that 20 percent never really materialized. I'll never come back and I personally believe this place is big a scam, I'd stay away from this restaurant and let them go under. Plenty of better restaurants a few doors down.

lTceE0I_08saIDdytncq6A.text: Wish we read these reviews before deciding to dine here. We were caught off guard by the hostess who stopped us while passing to get us to eat here. She offered to comp us a cocktail, which was nice bc alcohol is pricy in Singapore! The Singapore sling was 18 bucks a drink! Thinking it's a good deal, we ordered the pepper crab, Indonesian fried rice, and a large side of veggies. We knew it was a bad sign when our drinks came and we could not taste any alcohol in it. I usually get the Asian glow at the first sip and this drink was just like juice. The crab was not bad, it was actually good, but we really felt ripped off and scammed by the prices. Our meal was $150. Really? We did not leave full and the veggie side/rice were not better than a hawker stand that would have charged $5. They also charged us a dollar for the wet nap the put on the table. Who charges for a wet nap? Tacky and slimy. Sorry we wasted a dinner there; only white people were there and no locals- that should have been a good hint

R7dzm2ZGPi2Lshrvd7wHXg.text: We choose this place because we thought it would be nice to eat on the river at night.  Beware, businesses take major advantage of that including this one! there are three prices next to each entree but they will only ask you if you want medium or large.  We ordered medium which was a reasonable size.  They asked if we wanted rice or noodles with our meals.  I have never been to a Chinese restaurant that did not include these with your entree.  Here they did and charged 15 SGD each, when we asked they would not remove the charge even though they are listed nowhere as a side on the menu.  Our total was $188 SGD for two med size entrees, a mango salad, a side of rice, a side of noodles and two beers. The food was good but not THAT good!  Eat somewhere off the river and then go to that area for drinks after.
